chef.name: Asad Latif
chef.details: Gourmet expert Asad is a masterful Chef from Pakistan who gives grand cooking formulas on Lazzat with Asad on Metro One. He is the new master specialist that will undoubtedly stay viewers adhere to their TVs, regardless of whether they get joy from cooking or not. For this work on Bangladeshi food he is places in the list of top 10 chefs in Bangladesh, although currently he is working in Pakistan.  Not just he educates the most delightful dishes from Bangladesh. He likewise entertains gatherings of people with prompt answers for cooking tragedies.
chef.ingredients: 1 kg boneless chicken cut into small pieces, 1 cup yogurt, 2 tablespoons ginger garlic paste, 1 teaspoon cumin powder, 1 teaspoon coriander powder
chef.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, ginger garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and coat them well with the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 200°C. Thread the chicken pieces onto skewers and place them on a baking tray.Brush some oil over the chicken and bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes, until cooked through. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

chef.name: Shirley Chung
chef.details: Shirley Chung attended the California Culinary Academy, San Francisco, where she trained in classic French and Italian cuisine.She began by working and opening restaurants for Thomas Keller, Guy Savoy and Mario Batali. In season 11 of “Top Chef” in New Orleans, she was the finalist. She also competed on season 14 of BravoTV’s Top Chef, where she named the runner-up of Top Chef.In 2014, Shirley opened a restaurant in Orange County, Twenty Eight, featuring modern Chinese cuisine. Then after she opened China Poblano which was awarded the Best New Restaurant Award by James Beard in 2011.
chef.ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces,1/2 cup cornstarch,1/4 cup all-purpose flour,1 tablespoon five-spice powder, 1 tablespoon garlic powder
chef.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the cornstarch, all-purpose flour, five-spice powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.Dredge the chicken pieces in the flour mixture until well coated.Heat up some oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.Fry the chicken pieces in the oil until golden brown and crispy, about 5-7 minutes.Remove the chicken from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.Garnish with chopped scallions and serve hot.

chef.name: Vineet Bhatia
chef.details: He is a successful restauranteur with several popular names under his belt and is, of course, a famous Michelin star chef as well. You may recognise him from the show The Final Table, which saw him as an expert on one of the episodes. His recipes are generally easy to follow, and they use simple ingredients. We are totally bowled over by his recipe for Makhani Gravy!
chef.ingredients: 4 salmon fillets, cut into large cubes,1/2 cup Greek yogurt,1 tablespoon garlic paste,1 tablespoon ginger paste, 1 tablespoon red chili powder
chef.cookingMethod: In a large bowl, mix together the Greek yogurt, garlic paste, ginger paste,red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Add the salmon cubes and coat well with the marinade.Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.Preheat a grill or grill pan to high heat.Thread the salmon cubes onto skewers and brush with some oil.Grill the salmon skewers for 3-4 minutes on each side, until cooked through and slightly charred.Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot.

chef.name: Ferran Adrià
chef.details: Ferran Adrià is one of the most influential 21st century chefs in the world. His name is often associated with contemporary Spanish cuisine and as one of the forefathers of the trend known as molecular gastronomy.His cuisine are unique and creative as expressed in his now closed el Bulli restaurant. He reinvents classic dishes to give them new appearances, new textures and new personalities.One of his famous dishes is the spherified olive: an olive which looks like an olive, tastes like an olive but appears as something different in the mouth.
chef.ingredients: 500 grams green olives, pitted,250 grams water,10 grams salt,1 gram xanthan gum,0.5 grams citric acid
chef.cookingMethod: In a blender, puree the pitted olives until they form a smooth paste.Add the water, salt, xanthan gum, and citric acid to the blender and blend until fully incorporated. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any solids. Pour the liquid olive into a bottle and refrigerate until ready to use.

chef.name: Apirawat
chef.details: Three years working at Le Normandie, Mandarin Oriental Bangkok gave Chef Mai the chance to sharpen his ability from going by 3 Michelin culinary experts. That was the source of his energy for food and other culinary techniques. He trusts that everything on the plate must be consumable, lovely and completely delectable. From a model French establishment he built up his own particular East mets west style utilizing creative techniques. He won Iron Chef of Thailand 2014.
chef.recipeName: Green Papaya Salad with Soft-Shell Crab
chef.ingredients: 1 green papaya, peeled and shredded, 2 soft-shell crabs , 2 tablespoons fish sauce, tablespoons lime juice, 1 tablespoon palm sugar
chef.cookingMethod: Season the soft-shell crabs with salt and pepper. In a pan, heat some oil over medium-high heat. Fry the crabs until golden brown and crispy. In a bowl, mix together the fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, garlic, and chili. Add the shredded papaya to the bowl and toss to coat. Add the crushed peanuts and mix well. Arrange the papaya salad on a plate and top

chef.name: Hiroyuki Sakai
chef.details: Hiroyuki Sakai is best known as the second, final, and longest-serving Iron Chef French on the Japanese television show Iron Chef. He was named the “King of Iron Chefs” after emerging victorious from the show’s grand finale, a tournament involving all the active Iron Chefs. Sakai specializes in French cuisine. He was mentored by the Japan’s pioneer of French Cooking, Fujio Shido for three years.
chef.recipeName: Miso Soup with Clams and Vegetables
chef.ingredients: 1/2 cup miso paste, 4 cups dashi broth, 1 cup clams, cleaned and rinsed, 1 carrot, julienned, 1/2 onion, sliced ,1/2 cup shiitake mushrooms, sliced, 1/2 cup spinach leaves
chef.cookingMethod: In a pot, bring the dashi broth to a boil. Add the clams, carrot, onion, and shiitake mushrooms, and simmer until the vegetables are tender and the clams have opened. In a small bowl, whisk together the miso paste and a ladleful of the hot broth until smooth. Add the miso mixture to the pot and stir until well combined. Add the spinach leaves and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes. Serve hot.
